definition: to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

sentences.english: Galvatron destroys him and leads the Decepticons against Earth.
sentences.chinese: 驚破天摧毀紅蜘蛛，領霸天虎反撲地球。

sentences.english: The business lobby pushed back, and Canada-China relations were chilled.
sentences.chinese: 結果商界遊說團反撲，加中關係冷卻。

sentences.english: Oslash; Galvatron destroys him and leads the Decepticons against Earth.
sentences.chinese: 驚破天摧毀紅蜘蛛，領霸天虎反撲地球。

sentences.english: The late come-backs this season show that this team has character.
sentences.chinese: 本賽季最後時刻的反撲展示出這支球隊的個性。

sentences.english: The last time the Spurs have been nothing back, was forced to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 馬刺最後時刻的反撲也告無功而返，被迫繳械投降。

sentences.english: He turned back Los Angeles' final push in the fourth quarter with another layup.
sentences.chinese: 在第四節又用一次上籃徹底壓制了湖人的反撲。

sentences.english: I know the Lakers will come out hopping on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 我知道週日湖人將瘋狂反撲。

sentences.english: Village anger kills Su Jinrong in, kickback wildly.
sentences.chinese: 中村怒殺蘇金榮，瘋狂反撲。

sentences.english: The company leader led his men against the repeated counterattacks of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 連長率領戰士們反擊敵人一次又一次的反撲。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
to disarm/to lay down one's weapons/to surrender
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
